SENT.plain: Neurologic sequelae are known complications of carotid endarterectomy
The current overall perioperative stroke rate is 2-5% (1,2)

The incidence of perioperative morbidity and mortality is increased in certain patient subgroups, including neurologically unstable patients and patients who have known contralateral common or internal carotid artery occlusion (3-9)

We present the case of a patient who had known total right carotid artery occlusion and a known previous right cerebrovascular accident who sustained a contralateral deficit after a left internal carotid thromboendarterectomy with vein patch angioplasty
